name: Bank Erosion & Armoring Condition
functionStatement: Examines the role of bank processes and erosion in channel change. Observes patterns in sinuosity and curvature affecting habitat complexity.
descriptionMarkdown: "Integrates bank geometry, rooting, surface protection, raw or failing banks, and hardening to summarize erosion risk and sediment delivery. Compares meander migration rates and cutoff frequency to reference behavior; excessive migration or avulsions indicate instability."
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Map hardened versus natural or vegetated bank lengths and compute percent by type. Measure raw or eroding bank length and divide by total bank length across both banks."

inputs.label: Bank Erosion & Armoring Condition
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Predominantly natural banks with deeply rooted cover. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Some armoring or partial vegetation coverage. / Large portion of banks is armored or vegetation is sparse. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Failing armoring or widespread bare banks with severe instability. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: GIS digitization of raw bank segments from imagery.
